SENT.plain: Hepatocellular adenoma is a rare benign tumor of the liver
However, some complications, such as hemorrhage, rupture, and malignant transformation, have been reported previously
Surgical resection is considered to be the best choice of treatment, when adenomas are increasing in size, while resection is difficult to perform when multiple adenomas develop throughout the liver
Here, we report two cases of multiple hepatocellular adenomatosis
One patient had a history of aplastic anemia and the other had glycogen storage disease
We treated them with transcatheter arterial embolization (TAE) to prevent hemorrhage and rupture
After TAE, most parts of the adenomas showed necrotic change
These cases suggest that TAE is an effective treatment of hepatocellular adenomatosis
